messages.subject: Bob R; got your ears on?
messages.msgSnippet: Just to let everyone know that doesn t already. As Ron pointed out I do find books (and anything else LEGAL) over here in Japan for folks that ask. Sometimes I
messages.messageBody:
Just to let everyone know that doesn't already. As Ron
pointed out I do find books (and anything else LEGAL)
over here in Japan for folks that ask. Sometimes I can
find them very easily other times it takes me some
time to locate them throughout Japan and have them
shipped to me to send out. It has been a while since I
updated my site and for that I appologize. But to find
items or books any information you can get me such as
ISBN Number is extremely helpful so is a picture of
the cover as I am SLOWLY learning to read Japanese.

Bob R

=====
Check out "Cowboy" Bob's Books & Things at:
http://asia.geocities.com/gentleman9/index.html

__________________________________________________
Do you Yahoo!?
The New Yahoo! Search - Faster. Easier. Bingo
http://search.yahoo.com

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: Goto resources/Bob R; got your ears on?
messages.msgSnippet: Ron, I have that he died in 1831, but I don t have a birth date for him. Jim
messages.messageBody:
Ron,
I have that he died in 1831, but I don't have a birth date for him.

Jim

> Jim:
>
> Very helpful! Kiyotsugu, that is the artist. When did he work?
> (I need to pay more attention to your resources page, Jim. I noticed
> the book was listed there)
>
> Thanks very much!
> Ron
> ps Bob R, do you have this book? If so, how much is it? (please email
> me privately)

messages.messageBody:
Jim:

Very helpful! Kiyotsugu, that is the artist. When did he work?
(I need to pay more attention to your resources page, Jim. I noticed
the book was listed there)

Thanks very much!
Ron
ps Bob R, do you have this book? If so, how much is it? (please email
me privately)

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Goto resources
messages.msgSnippet: Ron, For sideline Goto the best book I m aware of is Studies in Kyo Goto (Kyo Goto no Kenkyu) by Koju Kasahara and Shigeo Akimoto, 1988.  It is in English
messages.messageBody:
Ron,
For sideline Goto the best book I'm aware of is "Studies in Kyo Goto" (Kyo
Goto no Kenkyu) by Koju Kasahara and Shigeo Akimoto, 1988. It is in English
and Japanese. The Seijo family chart shows one student of Seijo Masafuku
(the 5th) and his name is Enomoto Kiyotsugu. He later changed his name to
Kiyohisa. There are some other students of other generations listed too.

Jim


> Gentlemen:
>
> I have a set of koshirae that appears to have been made by a student
> of Goto Seijo (5th). The student is not listed in the Kinko Meikan.
> (info from the Murtha fittings volume)
>
> Is there any English language resource on the Goto artisans that
> would list genealogies, students etc. ?
> What is the best Japanese language resource on this kinko school?
>
> Thanks!
> Ron P.

messages.subject: Goto resources
messages.msgSnippet: Gentlemen: I have a set of koshirae that appears to have been made by a student of Goto Seijo (5th). The student is not listed in the Kinko Meikan. (info from
messages.messageBody:
Gentlemen:

I have a set of koshirae that appears to have been made by a student
of Goto Seijo (5th). The student is not listed in the Kinko Meikan.
(info from the Murtha fittings volume)

Is there any English language resource on the Goto artisans that
would list genealogies, students etc. ?
What is the best Japanese language resource on this kinko school?

Thanks!
Ron P.
